item.title: 01-Installation Notes
item.description: Introduction These notes are from memory, so they may be out of order.

item.title: Preparation
item.description: First, update apt sudo apt update #save this for the end # sudo apt upgrade -y Install Flatpak # install sudo apt install -y flatpak #if you want to install from software GUI sudo apt install -y gnome-software-plugin-flatpak #add the flathub repo flatpak remote-add --if-not-exists flathub https://flathub.

item.title: Install Tailscale
item.description: for raspberry pi sudo apt install curl -y general installation curl -fsSL https://pkgs.

item.title: 02-Import Keys
item.description: Install and Setup Install gnupg, nautilus integration (seahorse), and restart nautilus

item.title: retrieve backup file
item.description: gpg --output ~/backup.tar.gz --decrypt /my/remote/filesystem/backup_settings.tar.gz.gpg tar -xzf ~/backup.tar.gz decompress rclone settings

item.title: 03-Install and Setup ```rclone```
item.description: Install rclone sudo apt install -y curl curl https://rclone.org/install.sh | sudo bash If you have a previous config for rclone, it should be encrypted before backing up.

item.title: Install Common Tools
item.description: This assumes you installed a “minimal” version of Ubuntu apt packages first Update your software first

item.title: Download Repos
item.description: Install pip and gitman sudo apt update && sudo apt install python3-pip pip3 install git_manage configure

item.title: 05-Conda Install
item.description: Install Latest Anaconda / Miniconda Windows Linux 64-bit Miniconda 64-bit Miniconda Linux Install cd ~/Downloads wget https://repo.

item.title: 06-Install and Setup ```git```
item.description: Git Git is the command line program for interacting with a git repository

item.title: Install and Setup SSH
item.description: Basic Steps Make a new directory for holding keys mkdir ~/keys Decrypt your current keys

item.title: 08-install gitman
item.description: Gitman is my python based package for scanning a computer and pulling all your repositories off.

item.title: 10-Set Up Groups
item.description: add yourself to device groups for access to some USB devices in python sudo usermod -a -G <group1>,<group2>,.

item.title: 11-Setup Dconf
item.description: Introduction Dconf is where many keyboard shortcuts and user preferences exist.

item.title: 12-Syncthing
item.description: Install Add the release PGP keys: sudo curl -s -o /usr/share/keyrings/syncthing-archive-keyring.

item.title: Installing Windows Fonts
item.description: Derived from here: sudo apt install -y ttf-mscorefonts-installer sudo fc-cache -f

item.title: Enable UFW
item.description: To turn on UFW, sudo ufw allow 22 sudo ufw enable sudo ufw status sudo systemctl enable ufw sudo systemctl start ufw Specific Services SSH sudo ufw allow 22 Samba sudo ufw allow Samba syncthing sudo ufw allow syncthing sudo ufw allow syncthing-gui dnsmasq and dhclient for enabling wifi bridging in ubuntu

item.title: Install and configure fail2ban
item.description: Derived from here: sudo apt install -y fail2ban sudo systemctl enable fail2ban sudo systemctl start fail2ban sudo systemctl status fail2ban enter interactive mode

item.title: Post-Install Cleanup steps
item.description: sudo apt update #update repositories sudo apt install -f #fix broken packages sudo apt upgrade -y #install any updates sudo snap remove firefox # just to check sudo apt autoremove -y #remove unused packages sudo apt clean sudo reboot 0 # to restart immediately

item.title: Post-Install Miscellaneous Steps
item.description: Tweaking the GUI Open “Extensions” and turn off desktop icons Update firefox settings flatpak firefox settings found in ~/.

item.title: 99-Locking Down Ubuntu
item.description: Set bios admin password check sudoers group, make other users non-admin delete unused / unnecessary accounts reset root password lock all ssh keys with passphrase ensure .
